Room.Name: A dusty path
Room.Description: The dust on this path is making it quite difficult to gather in your surroundings. On both sides of you are trees and you think you hear birds chirp in the distance. Far to the north is what looks to be a castle, while south leads into the dwarven forests.

Room.Name: A dusty path
Room.Description: The dust on this path is making it quite difficult to gather in your surroundings. On both sides of you are trees and you think you hear birds chirp in the distance. To the north is a clearing and you make out a castle in the distance.

Room.Name: A peaceful clearing
Room.Description: As you enter the clearing you are surprised at the silence. Unlike the dusty road to the south or the castle to the north, it seems to fill your body with thoughts of peace and happiness. You can't understand what is giving off this sensation. The flowers? They are certainly plentiful here. Perhaps the stone markers that seem to enclose this clearing from the rest of the forest. No matter. It makes you feel good... that's it.

Room.Name: Before the Castle of the Giants
Room.Description: Standing before the Castle of the Giants you gaze in awe at the splendid display of wealth and influence. Two stone lions are on each side of the huge adamantite door north of you and glow with a fierce life that sends a shiver down your spine. Off to the south you see a large, tranquil-looking clearing.

Room.Name: Just inside the Castle
Room.Description: Standing just inside the castle, you can't help to think that the giants are a bit defensive about their castle. Iron-clad doors bar passage both east and west, while to the south the large adamantite door holds strong to keep out intruders. Since their growth in power, the giants spare no expense to be able to defend themselves against an attack.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. To the east there is the foyer of the castle and to the west the hallway continues.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A turn in the hallway
Room.Description: The turn here is lit by a single torch. The air is thick and quite uncomfortable, seeming to interrupt your breathing. This is not a place you would like to stand around. Perhaps you should continue on your way...

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. To the west, you see a wooden door. The hallway continues to the north where it meets a stairwell and south to more hallway.

Room.Name: A stairwell
Room.Description: The stairs here look as though laced with adamantite as they lead up to the second floor of the castle. There are torches every few steps to guide you as you go up the flight. To the south there is a hallway and a stone doorway leads east into the castle garden.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. To the west is the foyer and to the east the hall continues.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A turn in the hallway
Room.Description: The turn here is lit by a single torch. The air is thick and quite uncomfortable, seeming to interupt your breathing. This is not a place you would like to stand around. Perhaps you should continue on your way...

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. To the east you see a wooden door.

Room.Name: A stairwell
Room.Description: The stairs here look as though laced with adamantite as they lead up to the second floor of the castle. There are torches every few steps to guide you as you go up the flight. To the south there is a hallway and a stone doorway leads west into the castle garden.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. There is a door to the west.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A turn in the hallway
Room.Description: The turn here is lit by a single torch. The air is thick and quite uncomfortable, seeming to interupt your breathing. This is not a place you would like to stand around. Perhaps you should continue on your way...

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. There is a door to the east.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A turn in the hallway
Room.Description: The turn here is lit by a single torch. The air is thick and quite uncomfortable, seeming to interupt your breathing. This is not a place you would like to stand around. Perhaps you should continue on your way...

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. To the north you see a stairwell.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A stairwell
Room.Description: The steps here lead to the third floor of the castle. The torches make your shadow seem to dance to an ethereal music, providing entertainment for those seeking a unique perspective of themselves. The hallway is to the south and the stairwell leads up and down.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. There are doors to the east and west.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. There are doors to the east and west.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own. There are doors to the east and west.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: A hallway in the castle
Room.Description: The hallway is glittering with adamantite and various paintings from around the world. Torches line the walls making your shadow seem to have a life of its own.

Room.Name: The Lord's Stairwell
Room.Description: The Lord of the Giants seems to have spared no expense when decorating this stairwell. Golden curtains adorn the windows which look over a vast forest. Adamantite laces the paintings and makes them seem to hum with internal power. Even the torches leading to the fourth floor here are wrapped in gold. The hallway is to the north.

Room.Name: Top of the Lord's Stairwell
Room.Description: The top of the stairwell is as spectacular as the rest of the castle. Paintings, tapestries, sculptures, various busts of the Lord and other important people all decorate it with a marvelous display of wealth. Torches follow the steps to the third floor and a hallway continues north.

Room.Name: The Hallway of Giants
Room.Description: This hallway is much different than the others you have seen. No elaborately decorated paintings are to be found. Only a titanium door to the east with the insignia of the Captain of the Guard and an obsidian door to the west with a strange, black signal you are unable to understand atop it.

Room.Name: The Hallway of Giants
Room.Description: This hallway is much different than the others you have seen. No elaborately decorated paintings are to be found. Only a strong iron door to the west. To the east is an ivory door with a picture of a cleric praying to his god above it. A HUGE adamantite door is north of you, scratches and dried blood cover this door and a bone or two can be seen tossed a few feet from it.

Room.Name: The Lord's Chamber
Room.Description: You are totally blown away as you are hit with, not only the immense size and vastness of the chamber, but the scent of dried meat and blood wafting your way from an unknown direction. On the north wall you notice a large fireplace blazing like an inferno, providing ample heat for the Lord on cold nights. You also notice a large window looking out over a vast display of trees and sky on the north wall. A large table extends in the middle of this chamber from the west to east wall, with a large throne seated at the western side of the table.

Room.Name: The Treasure Room
Room.Description: You are shocked at the amount of, not only gold, but other rare and valuable items here. The ceiling looks as though it goes on forever since you can't seem to see it, only darkness. There is a ladder that gives you the ability to climb back up to the Lord's Chamber.

Room.Name: Battle Grounds
Room.Description: You are overcome with the smell of blood and rotting bodies as you enter this area. Made with different terrains to help the Battle Mistress become the best fighter in any circumstance. You see a rack of weapons on the wall next to the door and look out onto the field. You see hills, a mountainous area, a plains area, a small stream running through, and a granite arena in the center... All within this room. It is time to prove yourself.

Room.Name: The Dark Room
Room.Description: Only one torch is lit in this dark room and it is the one next to the door. All except the small table in the center of the room, the whole place is dark. On the table appears to be a map of the Castle, showing red checks near certain parts of it. After glancing it over and understanding nothing about it other than that it's a map, you turn to the rest of the room.

Room.Name: The Holy Room
Room.Description: The walls all around you glow and hum with a peaceful aura. Ivory laced with adamantite adorns an altar to the back of this room. Incense can be smelled emitting from a small bowl on the altar. This room seems to be the living quarters of a cleric or holy man and a rather rich one, at that. Priceless chalices and outstanding offerings are lying all around the room, sparkling greatly.

Room.Name: The Captain's Quarters
Room.Description: Bookshelves line the walls with books of law and order in this room. It serves more as an office to the Captain rather than living quarters. The captain is a bit smaller than the giants he commands, but is a superb leader, so they follow him wherever he takes them. There is a desk at the far wall and alot of paperwork sitting on top of it, waiting to be done.

Room.Name: The kitchen
Room.Description: The smells of excellent dishes waft toward you as you enter the castle kitchen. Pots bubble and pans sizzle with activity as they create an sound like an orchestra of sizzles and splashes. Dried fruit hangs in baskets from the ceiling. The cook get's most of her ingredients from nearby villages, using the influence of the giant's to get very good deals.

Room.Name: The storage room
Room.Description: Boxes, furniture and other things that usually just take up space have been placed here out of the way. It looks like the maid doesn't get here too often.

Room.Name: The decrepit garden
Room.Description: Walking in this garden is close to torture for your senses. Rotting fruits, decaying vegetables, and dying flowers all produce a very strong, pungent smell that seems to turn the stomach.

Room.Name: The decrepit garden
Room.Description: Walking in this garden is close to torture for your senses. Rotting fruits, decaying vegetables, and dying flowers all produce a very strong, pungent smell that seems to turn the stomach.

Room.Name: The decrepit garden
Room.Description: Walking in this garden is close to torture for your senses. Rotting fruits, decaying vegetables, and dying flowers all produce a very strong, pungent smell that seems to turn the stomach.

Room.Name: The decrepit garden
Room.Description: Walking in this garden is close to torture for your senses. Rotting fruits, decaying vegetables, and dying flowers all produce a very strong, pungent smell that seems to turn the stomach.

Room.Name: The bottom of a stairwell
Room.Description: There is a definate difference between this stairwell and the others you have seen. It not only smells different, but also has no torches on the walls. You see a faint glow coming from above and to the south you see darkness.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture. To the north and east are cell doors.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture. There is a cell door to the south and west.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture. There is a cell door to the north and west.

Room.Name: The castle dungeon
Room.Description: The smell of this place is dreadful indeed. Death hangs in a thick mist all around you. Blood and waste litter the floor in various spots. Off in the distance you hear screams of torture.

Room.Name: A dungeon cell
Room.Description: This is where the giants keep their prisoners. Be it treason, murder, thievery, or prisoner of war, your cell is the same. Small and Cold.

Room.Name: The Castle War Conference Room
Room.Description: This is where the giants meet to discuss the relations with other races, as well as where to move their troops. A large table dominates the center of the room. On it you see maps of Ofcol, New Thalos, Arkham, Elvenhame and various other towns and villages from around the realm. You look and see that Thalos has been crossed off a list on a board on the wall.

Room.Name: The lounge
Room.Description: This room looks like that of leisure and comfort. Soft cotton pillows with silk-laced sheets drape the surroundings. In the four corners of this room there is each a different chair. A throne, cushioned with a pillow of the finest elven silk, an ivory rocking chair bearing a cross at the top of it, a very uncomfortable looking spiked chair made of adamantite, and a chair that is very hard to focus on, it shifts and changes color while blending into the background.

Room.Name: The Library
Room.Description: This is where the king keeps his vast collection of books he has gathered from the far reaches of the realms. Long ladders climb up to frightening heights to reach those books higher up. Each wall has a book shelf on it as well as many rows of shelves in the room itself. Those books that are a bit more rare and hard to get are kept in the back room.

Room.Name: The Altar Room
Room.Description: This room is dominated by a large altar in the center of it. It is made of pure adamantite with ivory lacing the sides. Candles burn all around you giving off an eerie glow. This is where the giants come to worship their god.

Room.Name: A dark room
Room.Description: The only light available in this room is your own. You try to adjust your eyes to the darkness and begin to make out shapes along the walls, which you assume to be paintings. You bump into a few things, break a few things, and decide that you might want to leave this room.

Room.Name: Art Gallery
Room.Description: This room is where the Lord keeps all of his most prized art pieces. Statues made of pure gold, paintings of kings from other kingdoms, and also the banners of other cities and regions of the world, most likely kept as war trophies.

Room.Name: A dark hallway
Room.Description: The smell in this hallway seems double that of the dungeon. Dried blood and rotting corpses litter the floor. You hear screams to the south and know that someone is being tortured.

Room.Name: A dark hallway
Room.Description: The smell in this hallway seems double that of the dungeon. Dried blood and rotting corpses litter the floor. You hear screams coming from a door to the south and know that someone is being tortured.

Room.Name: The Torture Room
Room.Description: Every type of torture device thinkable is in this room and some that you could have never dreamed of. There is a furnace on one of the walls and you see branding sticks, chains and whips on a rack in the corner. Bloody, disemboweled limbs hang on hooks from the ceiling. This is definately a place of torture.

Room.Name: The storage room
Room.Description: Boxes, furniture and other things that usually just take up space have been placed here out of the way. It looks like the maid doesn't get here too often.

Room.Name: The Guest Room
Room.Description: The giants seemed to spare no expense in making their 'guests' feel as comfortable as possible. A dim glow radiates from a candle that rests upon a desk in the corner. Numerous papers also litter the desk and surrounding floor in what looks like a frenzy of parchment, many of which have the seal of the Obsidian Order. To the west is a wooden door.

Room.Name: The Misty Room
Room.Description: The mist in this room makes you gasp for air. It is thick with a chromatic mist that seems to burn your lungs. You see twinkles of strange light that flash all around you. The hazy mist burns also at your eyes as you find you can no longer focus on anything. Through teary and blood-shot eyes, you see a glowing cube floating in the middle of the room, seemingly the source of the mist.

ExtraDescription.Description: The cube floats magically in front of you, humming loudly. It emits a strange mist that tears at your eyes and lungs.

NPC.name: giant guard
NPC.description: Standing around 12 feet tall, this giant seems to keep things safe in the castle. Its narrow eyes look somewhat unintelligent, but hold a deep thrill for battle. These ruthless guards will tolerate nothing from almost no one.
NPC.longDescription: A strong-looking giant guard glances around, looking to stop trouble.

NPC.name: giant thiulor spy
NPC.description: Strange indeed, this giant seems to be adept at what was thought impossible of the giants. Stealth and guile. He is one of the few giants who has taken the time to become great at the skills of a spy. Personal assassin for the Lord at times, he knows how to kill with deadly force.
NPC.longDescription: A strange giant eyes you carefully while keeping to the shadows.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary Sneak Hide PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: giant lord
NPC.description: The Lord of the Giants is definately someone not to be messed with. Standing 15 feet tall, his muscles ripple and stretch all over his body, ready to defend his castle. You notice a dark look in his eyes as he hungers for your blood. With the alliance with the Obsidian Order now in affect, his thirst for more power may soon be fulfilled.
NPC.longDescription: The Lord of the Giants raises his arms and screams at your intrusion!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistRace
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden DetectGood Sanctuary ProtectionGood DetectIllusion

NPC.name: giant mistress Shannon
NPC.description: She is the epitomy of battle. Hair tossed about and muscles like that of no other female giant you have ever seen, she seems to possess both power and control to level anyone who challenges her.
NPC.longDescription: Screaming at your entrance, Shannon readies her weapon and attacks!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Warrior AreaAttack

NPC.name: giant cleric Iupsil
NPC.description: This giants seems to be at peace with himself. Praying to the gods when he is in trouble and using his holy magics to keep his comrades in good health, he seems just the person who you would want as a friend. He almost seems out of place in this dreadfully ruthless alliance.
NPC.longDescription: A large and holy-looking giant sits here, contemplating the future.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger StayArea Wimpy Cleric Warrior
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: human captain guard
NPC.description: Strangest thing you've seen yet. The Captain of the Guards seems to be a human. Standing about 6 feet tall, he hardly compares to the guards around him. His muscles have been hardened over the years of training with the giants and the scars over his body show him to be experienced enough to hold his own in combat.
NPC.longDescription: The Captain of the Castle Guard stands here, barking orders.
NPC.shortDescription: the Captain of the Castle Guard
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Wimpy Warrior AreaAttack AssistGuard

NPC.name: elf gardener servant
NPC.description: He doesn't like the current situation with the Obsidian Order and the Giants' new alliance. His pale face is lined in worry and discomfort while you notice the garden is going mostly bad. He is not allowed to leave the garden due to the recent buildup of giant and obsidian troops. He fears the worst is to come.
NPC.longDescription: An elven servant sits here, face wrought in sorrow.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger StayArea Wimpy Mage Indoors

NPC.name: obsidian guard
NPC.description: Having borrowed a few of the soldiers of the Obsidian Order, the Captain of the Guard leads these men in the castle and whatever battles they undergo. Probably not as strong as those who stayed with the order, this guard looks around in with little to no expression.
NPC.longDescription: A pale-looking human of the Obsidian Order keeps his post here.

NPC.name: dying gnome
NPC.description: He has committed an act against the giants and is paying the price. He spits up blood and coughs, trying to say something to you. All that you can make out is '..was.. framed'. He then goes into another coughing fit.
NPC.longDescription: A dying gnome is lying here, spitting up blood.

NPC.name: weeping elf
NPC.description: She has gotten herself into trouble and is now in the dungeon of the giants. Her hair matted with blood and swet makes her hardly seem as fair as elven women usually are. She says she doesn't even know what she has been charged with, but has to stay here for as long as they keep her.
NPC.longDescription: A weeping elf is chained to the wall here, struggling to break free.

NPC.name: weeping elf
NPC.description: She has gotten herself into trouble and is now in the dungeon of the giants. Her hair matted with blood and sweat makes her hardly seem as fair as elven women usually are. She says she doesn't even know what she has been charged with, but has to stay here for as long as they keep her.
NPC.longDescription: A weeping elf sits in the corner of her cell, sobbing.

NPC.name: librarian
NPC.description: He lives his life exactly how he wants. With books, LOTS of books. He met the lord once when the lord was in search of a certain forbidden piece of literature. After bargaining with the Lord he obtained the statis of 'Castle Librarian' and has been as pleased as can be ever since. With the new alliance at hand, his chances at receiving new literature have greatly improved.
NPC.longDescription: A large giant sits here, nose in a rather large book.

NPC.name: human torturer
NPC.description: Having been a friend of the Lord's since their youth, this human seems to share in the Lord's desire for pain and destruction. Burning elves live or beating a gnome to death, he cares not. It is merely part of his well-paid job.
NPC.longDescription: A human stands here with a grin, delivering pain and misery.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger Aggressive StayArea Wimpy Undead Warrior AreaAttack

NPC.name: screaming elf
NPC.description: He hardly represents royalty in a huddle mass on the floor. He was once a prince and was captured in a war against the giants. He now spends his days and nights screaming from the torture, until his body finally gives up. He wishes someone would put him out of his misery.
NPC.longDescription: An elf is chained to the floor here, screaming in agony at the torture.

NPC.name: battered human
NPC.description: Frightened at nearly everything around him, this human has lived most of his adult life in captivation. He doesn't want to be inside his cell or anywhere associated with the giants and their harsh rule.
NPC.longDescription: A battered and beaten human rests nervously in the corner.

NPC.name: starving elf girl
NPC.description: She looks very sickly and thin, even for an elf. Her fair colored skin has lost any beauty that it may have once had due to scars, bruises, and her lack of nutrition. Wearing only dirty rags she waits helplessly for a chance at freedom.
NPC.longDescription: A pale and very thin-looking elf girl sits here silently.

NPC.name: obsidian diplomat human
NPC.description: His sickly pale face make his extremely dark eyes look all the more dark. He has a strange scar running down his arms on each side, looking almost like what one would find on a prisoner or someone who has survived torture. You notice the insignia of the Obsidian order tattooed upon his left hand.
NPC.longDescription: A tall, pale human stands here silently, looking around the room.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Wimpy Warrior AreaAttack AssistGuard

NPC.name: Livgrud giant keeper
NPC.description: Having lost the favor of the Lord when his close relationship with Shannon dissolved, Livgrud now serves the giants as the keeper of the dungeon. Dark- grey skin as tough as rock covers his well-toned muscles that ripple over his entire body. Standing at 14 feet tall, he makes sure none of the prisoners escape.
NPC.longDescription: An incredibly large, mean-looking giant stands here growling.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger StayArea Warrior AreaAttack

Item.Name: claymore adamantite
Item.LongDescription: A claymore forged of adamantite rests here.

Item.Name: dagger thiulor
Item.LongDescription: A barbed and deadly dagger rests here in a pool of poison.

Item.Name: cloak stealth
Item.LongDescription: A cloak of strange material sits silently here.

Item.Name: mask spy
Item.LongDescription: A strange mask is here radiating the unknown.

Item.Name: banner
Item.ShortDescription: the Banner of the Obsidian Alliance
Item.LongDescription: A Banner of the Obsidian Alliance flows in the wind here.

Item.Name: ring glory
Item.LongDescription: A glorious ring shines brightly here, glowing with the strength of a giant.

Item.Name: huge broadsword
Item.LongDescription: A powerful weapon of destruction lies here, waiting to be wielded.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum NoRemove Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison

Item.Name: small spiked ring
Item.LongDescription: A ring sits here with jagged spikes coming from its sides.

Item.Name: spiked adamantite platemail
Item.ShortDescription: a suit of spiked adamantite platemail
Item.LongDescription: Some spiked piles of admantite rest on the floor.

Item.Name: spiked adamantite helm
Item.LongDescription: A spiked adamantite helm rests in the corner.

Item.Name: spiked adamantite leggings
Item.LongDescription: Some spiked adamantite leggings sit here.

Item.LongDescription: Some spiked adamantite boots are here.

Item.LongDescription: A crumpled up robe radiates a magical aura here.

Item.LongDescription: A Huge hammer draws your attention as it radiates power.

Item.LongDescription: The signet ring of the Captain of the Castle guard is here.

Item.LongDescription: The Badge of Order is here looking for an owner.

Item.LongDescription: Some highly valuable fur is here.

Item.LongDescription: A black ring made of onyx sits here, eminating evil.

Item.Name: spiked adamantite gauntlets
Item.LongDescription: A pair of adamantite gauntlets rest here, spikes shoved through the fists.

Item.LongDescription: A large, spoiled berry lies here rotting.

Item.LongDescription: A large adamantite key is here.

Item.LongDescription: A strange-looking vial sits here in the corner.

Item.LongDescription: A beautifully crafted ivory chalice sits here.

Item.LongDescription: A pile of strange-looking battle herbs sit here.
